Dialogue.Page: Hi, I'm MegaPiggy.
I've been part of the Outer Wilds modding scene since 2021, way back before we even had our own discord server. I didn’t start making mods right away, but once I did, I never really stopped.
I've contributed a lot to this community over the years, and while college has made modding a bit less of a priority, I'm not planning on disappearing anytime soon.
If you want to know more about what I've done, ask away!

DialogueOption.Text: What are you working on now?
What’s this about maintaining other people’s mods?
Any other Outer Wilds mods you’ve worked on?
Have you modded other games too?
Actually, I think I’ve heard enough for now.

Dialogue.Page: I’ve made a bunch of mods over the years. Project ARC was my Jam 5 entry, Axiom’s Refuge was for Jam 3, and The Box was a surprise drop during Jam 4 even though I was judging at the time.
I’ve also made mods like Discord Rich Presence, Ghost Translations, Involuntary Blink... <Pause=2/>and a few weird ones that barely anyone downloaded.
I’m one of the main developers behind New Horizons, the modding framework that powers all of the big story mods (except The Outsider).
I’ve added features like Vessel Warping, Eye of the Universe support, custom title screens, and lots of other stuff under the hood that helps mods work.
Right now, I’m working on Stowaway with atk and Repcon. It’s a mod centered on Giants Deep, though it goes way beyond just that planet.
Hope you check it out when it is released!
I kind of ended up as a janitor for old or abandoned mods. If someone doesn’t want to maintain theirs, I try to keep it running.
Stuff like The Stranger They Are, General Enhancements, Cheats Mod, Camera Shake, and more. I didn't make them, but I keep them playable.
I’ve worked on a lot of the code for The Vision, the first story mod ever made for Outer Wilds.
It laid the groundwork for what story-driven mods could be, and now we have amazing story mods that far surpass what we had back then.
I also worked on Real Solar System for a long time. I "stole" the mod from xen and added a bunch of dwarf planets and moons.
Eventually Trifid stole it from me, and of course, he never finished the story. Just left it orbiting aimlessly just like Quasar Project and Echo Hike. Typical Trifid.
...<Pause=2/>That was a joke if you couldn't catch it. I understand why they weren't finished because I too fall victim to overscoping and demotivation.
I made that mod in just 3 days straight.
It started as an ice planet and a moon, but then I had an idea to make the Alpha version of Outer Wilds was a parallel universe.
The Alpha Hearthians (that sounds weird now) tried to escape their supernova using a Nomai escape pod... and ended up in your universe by some unknown reason.
It was the first story mod (if you can even call it that) that I finished entirely on my own.
Not gonna lie, I kinda cringe at it now. I don’t really like touching it anymore.
Funny enough, I was originally going to be a judge for Jam 3, but xen kicked me off the judges last minute to make me submit the mod officially instead.
You finished Project ARC? That one was a bit of a journey, I kind of threw everything I had at the wall and hoped it worked. Hopefully the station didn’t break too many brains along the way.
This time I actually started when the jam began, but something came up halfway through that made it hard to keep working on it consistently.
I originally joked about making "The Box 2" since people kept pressuring me, but I had no clue what that would even be. Eventually I landed on an SCP-style Nomai space station prequel instead.
I loved making the station itself. Honestly it's probably the best 3D model I’ve ever made. And I even tried remixing some music for the first time, which was a new experience.
There are definitely weak points though. Emerald Reverie was supposed to have more content, but I ran out of time and it ended up just being where you get the battery.
atk said it felt like I was flexing my coding skills, but really coding is just what I’m best at. Story, music, and environments are tough for me, and I spent most of the jam struggling with those.
That left me very little time for the puzzles, so they ended up being simpler than I originally planned.
I didn’t think I could compete with the big jam teams anyway, so I just made whatever I could. But seeing all the mods, it kinda makes me think maybe I shouldn’t go solo next time.
Maybe I’ll update Project ARC to finish what I visioned... but no promises. I said that about Axiom’s Refuge too, and, well...
Outside of Outer Wilds, I’ve been involved in modding for quite a few games.
I started out coding on Roblox for a few years, then started modding Slime Rancher where my mods actually blew up for a while. I tried to make a huge one called Elior Forest but never finished it.
Eventually I ended up here, since I’ve always loved space. Later I also modded DREDGE (thanks to xen for recommending it) and it quickly became one of my favorite games.
I worked on a Minecraft mod called Peaceful Progression with xen, and I’ve done a few Lethal Company mods too. A couple of those hit over a million downloads, even if they’re pretty simple.
Funny enough, the Slime Rancher ones actually gave me revenue. The Lethal Company ones? Not a dime. Modding is weird like that.
No worries! Thanks for stopping by.
If you ever want to hear more, I’ll be right here.
